macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow rises while S&P 500 ends flat and Nasdaq falls as energy and industrials rally
items.summary: U.S. stocks closed mixed, with the S&P 500 essentially unchanged, the Dow Jones Industrial Average up about 0.6%, and the Nasdaq Composite down roughly 0.4%, as energy and industrials outperformed while tech lagged ahead of the U.S. jobs report.

items.title: Small caps outperform as Russell 2000 jumps over 1%
items.summary: The Russell 2000 index of smaller companies gained about 1.1%, significantly outperforming the flat S&P 500 and declining Nasdaq, reflecting a rotation into cyclicals and domestically focused stocks ahead of key macro data.

items.title: Energy stocks surge on geopolitical tensions and oil spike
items.summary: Energy shares led U.S. equity gains as oil and energy markets rallied sharply amid concerns over supply disruptions linked to strikes on Iranian energy infrastructure and broader Middle East tensions, pushing energy and industrials to the top of the sector performance tables.

items.title: Defense contractors rally on prospect of higher U.S. military spending
items.summary: Shares of major defense companies including Northrop Grumman, Lockheed Martin, and L3Harris climbed after President Donald Trump signaled he wants a sharp increase in U.S. defense spending, helping offset weakness in large tech names.

items.title: Broad underlying advance in U.S. equities despite flat S&P close
items.summary: Market breadth was notably positive, with roughly 70% of NYSE and S&P 500 stocks advancing and small caps strongly higher, indicating broad rotation under the surface even as the headline S&P 500 index finished near unchanged.

items.title: Apple slips as Alphabet overtakes it in market capitalization
items.summary: Alphabet surpassed Apple in market value, driven by recent relative strength in Alphabet shares versus Apple, which dipped and continued to lag amid concerns about growth and competitive pressures in key product lines.

items.title: Markets brace for U.S. nonfarm payrolls and Canada labor data
items.summary: Traders largely held back from making big macro bets as markets awaited the U.S. nonfarm payrolls report and simultaneous Canadian jobs data, with the upcoming labor numbers seen as pivotal for 2026 rate expectations and FX positioning.

items.title: U.S. dollar strengthens broadly on upbeat layoffs data
items.summary: The U.S. dollar advanced against major peers after positive U.S. layoffs data reinforced perceptions of ongoing labor-market resilience, influencing expectations for the Federal Reserve’s policy path and supporting the greenback across FX markets.

items.title: Energy and industrials lead sector performance while tech and healthcare lag
items.summary: Sector rotations continued, with energy and industrials acting as de facto hedges against geopolitical risk and pushing the Dow higher, while technology and healthcare shares underperformed and weighed on the Nasdaq.

items.title: Traders look ahead to Fed speakers and sentiment data for rate cues
items.summary: Following the jobs reports, markets are focused on upcoming U.S. housing data, multiple Federal Reserve speakers, and preliminary University of Michigan sentiment and inflation expectations as key inputs into interest-rate and FX positioning for early 2026.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin trades around $91,000 as market braces for $2.2B BTC/ETH options expiry and key U.S. macro decisions
items.summary: Bitcoin is hovering near $90,000–$91,000 around its options ‘max pain’ level while over $2.2 billion in BTC and ETH options are set to expire on Deribit, with traders positioning defensively ahead of the U.S. jobs report and a Supreme Court ruling on Trump-era tariffs that could inject additional volatility into crypto markets.

items.title: Bitcoin holds near $91,000 as traders await U.S. Supreme Court ruling on Trump tariffs
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading mostly sideways around $91,000 as markets watch for a U.S. Supreme Court decision on the legality of Trump-era tariffs, with prediction markets assigning a material probability that the ruling could limit presidential tariff authority, a scenario that may impact broader risk sentiment including crypto.

items.title: Bitcoin stays above $90,000 as total crypto market cap tops $3 trillion
items.summary: Bitcoin is holding above $90,000, roughly 6% higher since the start of the year, as the total cryptocurrency market capitalization surpasses $3 trillion and major altcoins like Ethereum and XRP outpace BTC’s gains in early 2026.

items.title: Ethereum’s ‘Fusaka’ (BPO-2) upgrade activates, boosting throughput and lowering fees
items.summary: Ethereum developers have successfully activated the ‘Fusaka’ upgrade, which increases the number of data blobs per block to improve scalability and reduce transaction costs, supporting a roughly 10% ETH price rise since the start of the year to around $3,200.

items.title: XRP jumps over 25% year-to-date amid renewed risk appetite in crypto
items.summary: XRP has surged more than 25% since the beginning of the year, significantly outperforming Bitcoin as investors rotate into higher‑beta altcoins amid a broader recovery in digital asset markets.

items.title: US spot Bitcoin ETFs record $1.2 billion in inflows over first two trading days of 2026
items.summary: Spot Bitcoin ETFs in the U.S. have attracted about $1.2 billion in net inflows across the first two trading days of the year, including a single‑day surge of roughly $697 million, signaling renewed institutional demand after late‑2025 outflows.

items.title: BlackRock’s IBIT leads renewed inflows as regulated crypto ETF demand broadens
items.summary: BlackRock’s iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) is leading a rebound in U.S. spot Bitcoin ETF inflows, highlighting expanding regulated demand from both institutional and wealth‑management channels after a period of net redemptions late last year.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: New Report Highlights AI's Potential to Accelerate Translational Research
items.summary: A HEPI and Taylor & Francis report finds that AI could strengthen the U.K.'s translational research system by enabling faster analysis of large datasets and improving interdisciplinary links, though uneven data availability and the need for AI skills remain key challenges.

items.title: Provably Secure Generative AI Achieves Five-Fold Safety Improvement
items.summary: Researchers introduce Reliable Consensus Sampling (RCS), a new technique that enhances generative AI security with theoretically controllable risk, achieving a five-fold increase in safety rates compared to current methods while maintaining comparable latency.

items.title: Security Teams Increasingly Focus on Energy Costs of AI Detection Models
items.summary: A recent study shows that security teams are now measuring anomaly detection models alongside their energy consumption and carbon output, with findings revealing that optimized models and feature reduction techniques can maintain strong detection performance while significantly reducing compute costs.

items.title: MIT Researcher Explores AI Applications for Power Grid Optimization
items.summary: MIT professor Priya Donti discusses how machine learning can optimize power grids to improve efficiency, increase resilience to extreme weather, and enable greater renewable energy integration, while addressing the challenge of building AI algorithms that respect physical grid constraints.

items.title: Interview Kickstart Launches Advanced Machine Learning and Agentic AI Program
items.summary: Interview Kickstart has introduced a new Advanced Machine Learning and Agentic AI Program designed to help software engineers transition into top machine learning and AI roles.

items.title: AgileRL Secures $7.5 Million in Funding
items.summary: AgileRL, a software development company, has raised $7.5 million in funding to advance its machine learning capabilities.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GameStop-owned EB Games proposes closing all New Zealand stores
items.summary: A new report indicates EB Games, owned by GameStop, has proposed shutting down all of its retail stores in New Zealand, signaling a major pullback of the brick-and-mortar chain from that market.

items.title: Discord reportedly files confidentially for IPO
items.summary: Discord has reportedly submitted a confidential filing for an initial public offering, marking a significant step toward going public for the popular gaming-focused communications platform.

items.title: Kinetic Games (Phasmophobia dev) launches indie publishing label
items.summary: Phasmophobia developer Kinetic Games has announced a new indie publishing label aimed at providing early-stage support and resources to smaller game creators.

items.title: Ubisoft closes Halifax studio weeks after workers vote to unionize
items.summary: Ubisoft has decided to close its Halifax studio just weeks after employees there voted to unionize, raising concerns and debate around labor relations and unionization in the games industry.

items.title: Industry insider teases secret fourth game for upcoming Xbox Developer Direct
items.summary: An industry insider has suggested that Xbox's January Developer Direct, already confirmed to feature Fable, Forza Horizon 6, and Beast of Reincarnation, will include a still-unannounced 'secret' fourth game, continuing a pattern from previous showcases.

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct dated with Fable, Forza Horizon 6, and Beast of Reincarnation
items.summary: Microsoft has announced a new Xbox Developer Direct later in January that will highlight Fable, Forza Horizon 6, and Beast of Reincarnation, offering extended looks at several of its major upcoming titles.

items.title: New Game+ Showcase criticized as underwhelming
items.summary: The creator-led New Game+ Showcase, positioned as an alternative to traditional publisher events, has drawn criticism for being dull and light on substantial announcements despite pre-event hype.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: CES 2026 showcases futuristic consumer tech from smart LEGO to robotaxis
items.summary: At CES 2026 in Las Vegas, exhibitors highlighted bendable and paper‑thin screens, Lego’s new Smart Play platform with sensor‑equipped Star Wars bricks that trigger coordinated lights and sounds, Clicks Technology’s clip‑on magnetic QWERTY phone keyboard, Razer’s Project Motoko over‑ear headset that performs smart‑glasses‑style functions, and Uber’s renewed push into robotaxis via a self‑driving vehicle developed with Lucid Motors and Nuro.

items.title: Hong Kong tech firms win top honors at CES 2026 Innovation Awards
items.summary: A record delegation of 61 Hong Kong companies exhibited at the Hong Kong Tech Pavilion at CES 2026, with startups spanning advanced materials, sustainable tech, electronics, robotics, and life & health; Widemount Dynamics Tech’s Smart Firefighting Robot was named “Best of Innovation” in the Product in Support of Human Security for All category, alongside awards for Eieling Technology and Point Fit Technology.

items.title: NASA cuts International Space Station mission short after astronaut medical issue
items.summary: NASA canceled its first planned spacewalk of the year and is weighing an early return of the current four‑person crew from the International Space Station after an unidentified astronaut experienced a medical issue; the agency says the crew member is now stable but all mission options are under review.
